title: Riot Please Bring In Offline Bots!!!!!!!!! RIOT RIOT RIOT - This Is For You!

replies.body:
If this does happen, people will begin to mod League of Legends much more. It shouldn't be a bad thing since I don't think there's anyway for people to mod online games. But you have to understand Riot's caution, because if they give this information out, and something does happen, then it's going to cause massive problems.

2nd reason is that they don't want people to see their code. Riot games was a small start-up and had very limited means to program the games, as a consequence of this the game is programmed like shit.

> 2nd reason is that they don't want people to see their code. Riot games was a small start-up and had very limited means to program the games, as a consequence of this the game is programmed like shit.

Dota have managed it successfully, so i don't see how Riot wouldn't be able to implement it without that sort of stuff happening. I mean it would take a while to make it so people can't mod and what not. Think about like this, if they were to bring it in, in order to play offline you would first need to login online, your account would then save to your files/client (like minecraft) and then after that you would be able to login offline and play bots! I don't mind if it doesn't happen and I understand the complexity of it all but again just a thought!

You will never be able to stop people from not modding it. I can confirm that. I'm not sure if you're aware, but people are modding the game right now. Giving players the actual game just makes modding a lot easier. Not that mods are a bad thing necessarily, we would finally get that sandbox mode people want.

Riot is terrible at disclosing information like this with fans, but I think there are 3 reasons why Offline Bots hasn't happened yet;

1. League of Legends is coded like shit. They would rather no-one saw this, but it has long been speculated to be the truth.

2. If mods got really popular, say to Minecraft levels of use, the LCS would become less and less relevant. Since really no one would be playing the official mode much anymore.

3. Offline Bots would lead to sandbox mode. Riot actually talked about this surprisingly, and they said that they didn't want grinding for hours in a sandbox mode to become the norm for playing League.

Oh, your lucky none of the Summoners that say "But then the hackers will be able to hack LoL better" and other crap, have come on yet.

BTW, I love the idea of offline mode.

I also would like other modes like a campaign mode where you can do stories of each champion.(This probably won't happen and idc if it does or doesn't but I think it's a good idea)
But then the hackers will be able to hack LoL better
